DOC.brief_title: Early Goal Directed Sedation on Microcirculation in Septic Shock
DOC.detailed_description: Recent studies suggest that early goal directed sedation might improve the outcome of critically ill patients. The investigators will conduct a prospective, single-center, randomized, double-blinded, controlled study to investigate the effect of early goal directed sedation on microcirculation in early septic shock patients with relative stable hemodynamics.
DOC.criteria: Septic shock patients despite early goal directed therapy Required sedation Age< 18 Pregnancy Bradycardia (HR<55bpm) Systolic blood pressure < 80 mmHg / mean arterial pressure < 50 mmHg on maximal support Death imminent Unlikely to survive 90 days Acute liver failure Dementia Highgrade block in the absence of a functioning pacemaker.
